head.title: Metro Business; SPX Begins Echlin Offer

hedline.hl1: Metro Business; SPX Begins Echlin Offer

abstract.p: SPX Corp formally begins its exchange offer to take over Echlin Inc, auto parts maufacturer based in Branford, Conn; deal is valued at $46.17 a share, or about $3 billion (S)

block.p: The SPX Corporation formally began yesterday its exchange offer to take over Echlin Inc., the auto parts maufacturer based in Branford, Conn.

Under the terms of the offer, Echlin shareholders would receive $12 in cash plus 0.4796 of an SPX share for each share of Echlin stock tendered. Based on the $72.375 a share closing price of SPX stock yesterday, the deal is valued at $46.71 a share, or a total of about $3 billion. Echlin stock closed yesterday at $47.315.
The SPX Corporation formally began yesterday its exchange offer to take over Echlin Inc., the auto parts maufacturer based in Branford, Conn.

Under the terms of the offer, Echlin shareholders would receive $12 in cash plus 0.4796 of an SPX share for each share of Echlin stock tendered. Based on the $72.375 a share closing price of SPX stock yesterday, the deal is valued at $46.71 a share, or a total of about $3 billion. Echlin stock closed yesterday at $47.315.
The expiration date of the offer is May 28, but it may be extended by SPX, which is based in Muskegon, Mich. SPX is also an auto parts maker.

Echlin has been fighting the hostile bid since February and has asked shareholders to wait until its board makes a recommendation on the offer. The company said the board would make a recommendation within 10 days.
